trans-unit.source: Use Zeppelin notebooks with Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux | Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Zeppelin notebooks with Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux | Azure

trans-unit.source: Step-by-step instructions on how to use Zeppelin notebooks with Spark clusters on HDInsight Linux.
trans-unit.target: Step-by-step instructions on how to use Zeppelin notebooks with Spark clusters on HDInsight Linux.

trans-unit.source: Use Zeppelin notebooks with Spark cluster on HDInsight (Linux)
trans-unit.target: Use Zeppelin notebooks with Spark cluster on HDInsight (Linux)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to install Zeppelin notebooks on Spark clusters and how to use the Zeppelin notebooks.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to install Zeppelin notebooks on Spark clusters and how to use the Zeppelin notebooks.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Zeppelin notebook for HDInsight Spark cluster is an offering just to showcase how to use Zeppelin in an Azure HDInsight Spark environment.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] Zeppelin notebook for HDInsight Spark cluster is an offering just to showcase how to use Zeppelin in an Azure HDInsight Spark environment.

trans-unit.source: If you want to use notebooks to work with HDInsight Spark, we recommend that you use Jupyter notebooks instead.
trans-unit.target: If you want to use notebooks to work with HDInsight Spark, we recommend that you use Jupyter notebooks instead.

trans-unit.source: Jupyter notebooks also provide different kernel options, such as Scala, and will continue to have feature improvements.
trans-unit.target: Jupyter notebooks also provide different kernel options, such as Scala, and will continue to have feature improvements.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to use Jupyter notebooks with HDInsight spark, see [Run Spark SQL queries using a Jupyter notebook](hdinsight-apache-spark-jupyter-spark-sql.md#jupyter).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to use Jupyter notebooks with HDInsight spark, see [Run Spark SQL queries using a Jupyter notebook](hdinsight-apache-spark-jupyter-spark-sql.md#jupyter).

trans-unit.source: **Prerequisites:**
trans-unit.target: **Prerequisites:**

trans-unit.source: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have an Azure subscription.
trans-unit.target: Before you begin this tutorial, you must have an Azure subscription.

trans-unit.source: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).
trans-unit.target: See [Get Azure free trial](https://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/get-azure-free-trial-for-testing-hadoop-in-hdinsight/).

trans-unit.source: An Apache Spark cluster.
trans-unit.target: An Apache Spark cluster.

trans-unit.source: For instructions, see [Create Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).
trans-unit.target: For instructions, see [Create Apache Spark clusters in Azure HDInsight](hdinsight-apache-spark-provision-clusters.md).

trans-unit.source: An SSH client.
trans-unit.target: An SSH client.

trans-unit.source: For Linux and Unix distributions or Macintosh OS X, the `ssh` command is provided with the operating system.
trans-unit.target: For Linux and Unix distributions or Macintosh OS X, the `ssh` command is provided with the operating system.

trans-unit.source: For Windows, we recommend [PuTTY](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html)
trans-unit.target: For Windows, we recommend [PuTTY](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to use an SSH client other than `ssh` or PuTTY, please consult the documentation for your client on how to establish an SSH tunnel.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] If you want to use an SSH client other than `ssh` or PuTTY, please consult the documentation for your client on how to establish an SSH tunnel.

trans-unit.source: A web browser that can be configured to use a SOCKS proxy
trans-unit.target: A web browser that can be configured to use a SOCKS proxy

trans-unit.source: __(optional)__: A plugin such as [FoxyProxy](http://getfoxyproxy.org/,) that can apply rules that only route specific requests through the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: __(optional)__: A plugin such as [FoxyProxy](http://getfoxyproxy.org/,) that can apply rules that only route specific requests through the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.WARNING] Without a plugin such as FoxyProxy, all requests made through the browser may be routed through the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.WARNING] Without a plugin such as FoxyProxy, all requests made through the browser may be routed through the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: This can result in slower loading of web pages in your browser.
trans-unit.target: This can result in slower loading of web pages in your browser.

trans-unit.source: Install Zeppelin as part of cluster creation
trans-unit.target: Install Zeppelin as part of cluster creation

trans-unit.source: You can install Zeppelin on a Spark cluster using script action.
trans-unit.target: You can install Zeppelin on a Spark cluster using script action.

trans-unit.source: Script action uses custom scripts to install components on the cluster that are not available by default.
trans-unit.target: Script action uses custom scripts to install components on the cluster that are not available by default.

trans-unit.source: The custom script to install Zeppelin on a Spark cluster is available at **https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxincubatorzeppelinv01/install-zeppelin-spark151-v01.sh**.
trans-unit.target: The custom script to install Zeppelin on a Spark cluster is available at **https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxincubatorzeppelinv01/install-zeppelin-spark151-v01.sh**.

trans-unit.source: Using the Azure Portal
trans-unit.target: Using the Azure Portal

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to use HDInsight .NET SDK to run script action to install Zeppelin, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md#use-a-script-action-from-the-azure-portal).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to use HDInsight .NET SDK to run script action to install Zeppelin, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md#use-a-script-action-from-the-azure-portal).

trans-unit.source: You must make a couple of changes to the instructions in that article.
trans-unit.target: You must make a couple of changes to the instructions in that article.

trans-unit.source: You must use the script for installing Zeppelin.
trans-unit.target: You must use the script for installing Zeppelin.

trans-unit.source: The script to use is **https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxincubatorzeppelinv01/install-zeppelin-spark151-v01.sh**.
trans-unit.target: The script to use is **https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxincubatorzeppelinv01/install-zeppelin-spark151-v01.sh**.

trans-unit.source: You must run the script action only on the headnode.
trans-unit.target: You must run the script action only on the headnode.

trans-unit.source: The script does not need any parameters.
trans-unit.target: The script does not need any parameters.

trans-unit.source: Using HDInsight .NET SDK
trans-unit.target: Using HDInsight .NET SDK

trans-unit.source: For instructions on how to use HDInsight .NET SDK to run script action to install Zeppelin, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md#use-a-script-action-from-the-hdinsight-net-sdk).
trans-unit.target: For instructions on how to use HDInsight .NET SDK to run script action to install Zeppelin, see [Customize HDInsight clusters using Script Action](hdinsight-hadoop-customize-cluster-linux.md#use-a-script-action-from-the-hdinsight-net-sdk).

trans-unit.source: You must make a couple of changes to the instructions in that article.
trans-unit.target: You must make a couple of changes to the instructions in that article.

trans-unit.source: You must use the script for installing Zeppelin.
trans-unit.target: You must use the script for installing Zeppelin.

trans-unit.source: The script to use is **https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxincubatorzeppelinv01/install-zeppelin-spark151-v01.sh**.
trans-unit.target: The script to use is **https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxincubatorzeppelinv01/install-zeppelin-spark151-v01.sh**.

trans-unit.source: The script does not need any parameters.
trans-unit.target: The script does not need any parameters.

trans-unit.source: Set the cluster type you are creating to Spark.
trans-unit.target: Set the cluster type you are creating to Spark.

trans-unit.source: Using Azure PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Using Azure PowerShell

trans-unit.source: Use the following PowerShell snippet to create a Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux with Zeppelin installed.
trans-unit.target: Use the following PowerShell snippet to create a Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux with Zeppelin installed.

trans-unit.source: Make sure you have PowerShell installed before you proceed.
trans-unit.target: Make sure you have PowerShell installed before you proceed.

trans-unit.source: See [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md) for instructions.
trans-unit.target: See [Install and configure Azure PowerShell](../powershell-install-configure.md) for instructions.

trans-unit.source: Set up SSH tunneling to access a Zeppelin notebook
trans-unit.target: Set up SSH tunneling to access a Zeppelin notebook

trans-unit.source: You will use SSH tunnels to access the Zeppelin notebooks running on Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux.
trans-unit.target: You will use SSH tunnels to access the Zeppelin notebooks running on Spark cluster on HDInsight Linux.

trans-unit.source: The steps below demonstrate how to create an SSH tunnel using ssh command line (Linux) and PuTTY (Windows).
trans-unit.target: The steps below demonstrate how to create an SSH tunnel using ssh command line (Linux) and PuTTY (Windows).

trans-unit.source: Create a tunnel using the SSH command (Linux)
trans-unit.target: Create a tunnel using the SSH command (Linux)

trans-unit.source: Use the following command to create an SSH tunnel using the `ssh` command.
trans-unit.target: Use the following command to create an SSH tunnel using the `ssh` command.

trans-unit.source: Replace __USERNAME__ with an SSH user for your HDInsight cluster, and replace __CLUSTERNAME__ with the name of your HDInsight cluster
trans-unit.target: Replace __USERNAME__ with an SSH user for your HDInsight cluster, and replace __CLUSTERNAME__ with the name of your HDInsight cluster

trans-unit.source: This creates a connection that routes traffic to local port 9876 to the cluster over SSH.
trans-unit.target: This creates a connection that routes traffic to local port 9876 to the cluster over SSH.

trans-unit.source: The options are:
trans-unit.target: The options are:

trans-unit.source: **D 9876** - The local port that will route traffic through the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: **D 9876** - The local port that will route traffic through the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: **C** - Compress all data, because web traffic is mostly text.
trans-unit.target: **C** - Compress all data, because web traffic is mostly text.

trans-unit.source: **2** - Force SSH to try protocol version 2 only.
trans-unit.target: **2** - Force SSH to try protocol version 2 only.

trans-unit.source: **q** - Quiet mode.
trans-unit.target: **q** - Quiet mode.

trans-unit.source: **T** - Disable pseudo-tty allocation, since we are just forwarding a port.
trans-unit.target: **T** - Disable pseudo-tty allocation, since we are just forwarding a port.

trans-unit.source: **n** - Prevent reading of STDIN, since we are just forwarding a port.
trans-unit.target: **n** - Prevent reading of STDIN, since we are just forwarding a port.

trans-unit.source: **N** - Do not execute a remote command, since we are just forwarding a port.
trans-unit.target: **N** - Do not execute a remote command, since we are just forwarding a port.

trans-unit.source: **f** - Run in the background.
trans-unit.target: **f** - Run in the background.

trans-unit.source: If you configured the cluster with an SSH key, you may need use the `-i` parameter and specify the path to the private SSH key.
trans-unit.target: If you configured the cluster with an SSH key, you may need use the `-i` parameter and specify the path to the private SSH key.

trans-unit.source: Once the command finishes, traffic sent to port 9876 on the local computer will be routed over Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) to the cluster head node and appear to originate there.
trans-unit.target: Once the command finishes, traffic sent to port 9876 on the local computer will be routed over Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) to the cluster head node and appear to originate there.

trans-unit.source: Create a tunnel using PuTTY (Windows)
trans-unit.target: Create a tunnel using PuTTY (Windows)

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to create an SSH tunnel using PuTTY.
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to create an SSH tunnel using PuTTY.

trans-unit.source: Open PuTTY, and enter your connection information.
trans-unit.target: Open PuTTY, and enter your connection information.

trans-unit.source: If you are not familiar with PuTTY, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md) for information on how to use it with HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: If you are not familiar with PuTTY, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md) for information on how to use it with HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: In the **Category** section to the left of the dialog, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and then select **Tunnels**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Category** section to the left of the dialog, expand **Connection**, expand **SSH**, and then select **Tunnels**.

trans-unit.source: Provide the following information on the **Options controlling SSH port forwarding** form:
trans-unit.target: Provide the following information on the **Options controlling SSH port forwarding** form:

trans-unit.source: **Source port** - The port on the client that you wish to forward.
trans-unit.target: **Source port** - The port on the client that you wish to forward.

trans-unit.source: For example, **9876**.
trans-unit.target: For example, **9876**.

trans-unit.source: **Destination** - The SSH address for the Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: **Destination** - The SSH address for the Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For example, **mycluster-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.
trans-unit.target: For example, **mycluster-ssh.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: **Dynamic** - Enables dynamic SOCKS proxy routing.
trans-unit.target: **Dynamic** - Enables dynamic SOCKS proxy routing.

trans-unit.source: ![image of tunneling options](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/puttytunnel.png)
trans-unit.target: ![image of tunneling options](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/puttytunnel.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **Add** to add the settings, and then click **Open** to open an SSH connection.
trans-unit.target: Click **Add** to add the settings, and then click **Open** to open an SSH connection.

trans-unit.source: When prompted, log in to the server.
trans-unit.target: When prompted, log in to the server.

trans-unit.source: This will establish an SSH session and enable the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: This will establish an SSH session and enable the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: Use the tunnel from your browser
trans-unit.target: Use the tunnel from your browser

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this section use the FireFox browser, as it is freely available for Linux, Unix, Macintosh OS X and Windows systems.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] The steps in this section use the FireFox browser, as it is freely available for Linux, Unix, Macintosh OS X and Windows systems.

trans-unit.source: Other modern browsers such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, or Apple Safari should work as well; however, the FoxyProxy plugin used in some steps may not be available for all browsers.
trans-unit.target: Other modern browsers such as Google Chrome, Microsoft Edge, or Apple Safari should work as well; however, the FoxyProxy plugin used in some steps may not be available for all browsers.

trans-unit.source: Configure the browser to use **localhost:9876** as a **SOCKS v5** proxy.
trans-unit.target: Configure the browser to use **localhost:9876** as a **SOCKS v5** proxy.

trans-unit.source: Here's what the Firefox settings look like.
trans-unit.target: Here's what the Firefox settings look like.

trans-unit.source: If you used a different port than 9876, change the port to the one you used:
trans-unit.target: If you used a different port than 9876, change the port to the one you used:

trans-unit.source: ![image of Firefox settings](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/socks.png)
trans-unit.target: ![image of Firefox settings](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/socks.png)

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting **Remote DNS** will resolve Domain Name System (DNS) requests by using the HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Selecting **Remote DNS** will resolve Domain Name System (DNS) requests by using the HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: If this is unselected, DNS will be resolved locally.
trans-unit.target: If this is unselected, DNS will be resolved locally.

trans-unit.source: Verify that traffic is being routed through the tunnel by vising a site such as [http://www.whatismyip.com/](http://www.whatismyip.com/) with the proxy settings enabled and disabled in Firefox.
trans-unit.target: Verify that traffic is being routed through the tunnel by vising a site such as [http://www.whatismyip.com/](http://www.whatismyip.com/) with the proxy settings enabled and disabled in Firefox.

trans-unit.source: While the settings are enabled, the IP address will be for a machine in the Microsoft Azure datacenter.
trans-unit.target: While the settings are enabled, the IP address will be for a machine in the Microsoft Azure datacenter.

trans-unit.source: Browser extensions
trans-unit.target: Browser extensions

trans-unit.source: While configuring the browser to use the tunnel works, you don't usually want to route all traffic over the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: While configuring the browser to use the tunnel works, you don't usually want to route all traffic over the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: Browser extensions such as [FoxyProxy](http://getfoxyproxy.org/) support pattern matching for URL requests (FoxyProxy Standard or Plus only), so that only requests for specific URLs will be sent over the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: Browser extensions such as [FoxyProxy](http://getfoxyproxy.org/) support pattern matching for URL requests (FoxyProxy Standard or Plus only), so that only requests for specific URLs will be sent over the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: If you have installed FoxyProxy Standard, use the following steps to configure it to only forward traffic for HDInsight over the tunnel.
trans-unit.target: If you have installed FoxyProxy Standard, use the following steps to configure it to only forward traffic for HDInsight over the tunnel.

trans-unit.source: Open the FoxyProxy extension in your browser.
trans-unit.target: Open the FoxyProxy extension in your browser.

trans-unit.source: For example, in Firefox, select the FoxyProxy icon next to the address field.
trans-unit.target: For example, in Firefox, select the FoxyProxy icon next to the address field.

trans-unit.source: ![foxyproxy icon](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxyproxy.png)
trans-unit.target: ![foxyproxy icon](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxyproxy.png)

trans-unit.source: Select **Add New Proxy**, select the **General** tab, and then enter a proxy name of **HDInsightProxy**.
trans-unit.target: Select **Add New Proxy**, select the **General** tab, and then enter a proxy name of **HDInsightProxy**.

trans-unit.source: ![foxyproxy general](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxygeneral.png)
trans-unit.target: ![foxyproxy general](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxygeneral.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the **Proxy Details** tab and populate the following fields:
trans-unit.target: Select the **Proxy Details** tab and populate the following fields:

trans-unit.source: **Host or IP Address** - This is localhost, since we are using an SSH tunnel on the local machine.
trans-unit.target: **Host or IP Address** - This is localhost, since we are using an SSH tunnel on the local machine.

trans-unit.source: **Port** - This is the port you used for the SSH tunnel.
trans-unit.target: **Port** - This is the port you used for the SSH tunnel.

trans-unit.source: **SOCKS proxy** - Select this to enable the browser to use the tunnel as a proxy.
trans-unit.target: **SOCKS proxy** - Select this to enable the browser to use the tunnel as a proxy.

trans-unit.source: **SOCKS v5** - Select this to set the required version for the proxy.
trans-unit.target: **SOCKS v5** - Select this to set the required version for the proxy.

trans-unit.source: ![foxyproxy proxy](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxyproxyproxy.png)
trans-unit.target: ![foxyproxy proxy](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxyproxyproxy.png)

trans-unit.source: Select the **URL Patterns** tab, and then select **Add New Pattern**.
trans-unit.target: Select the **URL Patterns** tab, and then select **Add New Pattern**.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to define the pattern, and then click **OK**:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to define the pattern, and then click **OK**:

trans-unit.source: **Pattern Name** - **zeppelinnotebook** - This is just a friendly name for the pattern.
trans-unit.target: **Pattern Name** - **zeppelinnotebook** - This is just a friendly name for the pattern.

trans-unit.source: **URL pattern** - **\*hn0\*** - This defines a pattern that matches the internal fully qualified domain name of endpoint where the Zeppelin notebooks are hosted.
trans-unit.target: **URL pattern** - **\*hn0\*** - This defines a pattern that matches the internal fully qualified domain name of endpoint where the Zeppelin notebooks are hosted.

trans-unit.source: Because Zeppelin notebooks are available only on the headnode0 of the cluster, and the endpoint is typically `http://hn0-<string>.internal.cloudapp.net`, using the pattern **hn0** would ensure that the request is redirected to the Zeppelin endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Because Zeppelin notebooks are available only on the headnode0 of the cluster, and the endpoint is typically `http://hn0-<string>.internal.cloudapp.net`, using the pattern **hn0** would ensure that the request is redirected to the Zeppelin endpoint.

trans-unit.source: ![foxyproxy pattern](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxypattern.png)
trans-unit.target: ![foxyproxy pattern](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/foxypattern.png)

trans-unit.source: Click **OK** to add the proxy and close **Proxy Settings**.
trans-unit.target: Click **OK** to add the proxy and close **Proxy Settings**.

trans-unit.source: At the top of the FoxyProxy dialog, change **Select Mode** to **Use proxies based on their pre-defined patterns and priorities**, and then click **Close**.
trans-unit.target: At the top of the FoxyProxy dialog, change **Select Mode** to **Use proxies based on their pre-defined patterns and priorities**, and then click **Close**.

trans-unit.source: ![foxyproxy select mode](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/selectmode.png)
trans-unit.target: ![foxyproxy select mode](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-use-zeppelin-notebook/selectmode.png)

trans-unit.source: After following these steps, only requests for URLs that contain the string __internal.cloudapp.net__ will be routed over the SSL tunnel.
trans-unit.target: After following these steps, only requests for URLs that contain the string __internal.cloudapp.net__ will be routed over the SSL tunnel.

trans-unit.source: Access the Zeppelin notebook
trans-unit.target: Access the Zeppelin notebook

trans-unit.source: Once you have SSH tunneling setup, you can use the following steps to access Zeppelin notebook on the Spark cluster by following the steps below.
trans-unit.target: Once you have SSH tunneling setup, you can use the following steps to access Zeppelin notebook on the Spark cluster by following the steps below.

trans-unit.source: From the web browser, open the following endpoint:
trans-unit.target: From the web browser, open the following endpoint:

trans-unit.source: **hn0** denotes headnode0
trans-unit.target: **hn0** denotes headnode0

trans-unit.source: **myspar** is the first six letters of the Spark cluster name.
trans-unit.target: **myspar** is the first six letters of the Spark cluster name.

trans-unit.source: **9995** is the port where Zeppelin notebook is accessible.
trans-unit.target: **9995** is the port where Zeppelin notebook is accessible.

trans-unit.source: Create a new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Create a new notebook.

trans-unit.source: From the header pane, click **Notebook**, and then click **Create New Note**.
trans-unit.target: From the header pane, click **Notebook**, and then click **Create New Note**.

trans-unit.source: ![Create a new Zeppelin notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.createnewnote.png "Create a new Zeppelin notebook")
trans-unit.target: ![Create a new Zeppelin notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.createnewnote.png "Create a new Zeppelin notebook")

trans-unit.source: On the same page, under the **Notebook** heading, you should see a new notebook with the name starting with **Note XXXXXXXXX**.
trans-unit.target: On the same page, under the **Notebook** heading, you should see a new notebook with the name starting with **Note XXXXXXXXX**.

trans-unit.source: Click the new notebook.
trans-unit.target: Click the new notebook.

trans-unit.source: On the web page for the new notebook, click the heading, and change the name of the notebook if you want to.
trans-unit.target: On the web page for the new notebook, click the heading, and change the name of the notebook if you want to.

trans-unit.source: Press ENTER to save the name change.
trans-unit.target: Press ENTER to save the name change.

trans-unit.source: Also, make sure the notebook header shows a **Connected** status in the top-right corner.
trans-unit.target: Also, make sure the notebook header shows a **Connected** status in the top-right corner.

trans-unit.source: ![Zeppelin notebook status](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.newnote.connected.png "Zeppelin notebook status")
trans-unit.target: ![Zeppelin notebook status](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.newnote.connected.png "Zeppelin notebook status")

trans-unit.source: Load sample data into a temporary table.
trans-unit.target: Load sample data into a temporary table.

trans-unit.source: When you create a Spark cluster in HDInsight, the sample data file, **hvac.csv**, is copied to the associated storage account under **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.
trans-unit.target: When you create a Spark cluster in HDInsight, the sample data file, **hvac.csv**, is copied to the associated storage account under **\HdiSamples\SensorSampleData\hvac**.

trans-unit.source: In the empty paragraph that is created by default in the new notebook, paste the following snippet.
trans-unit.target: In the empty paragraph that is created by default in the new notebook, paste the following snippet.

trans-unit.source: Press **SHIFT + ENTER** or click the **Play** button for the paragraph to run the snippet.
trans-unit.target: Press **SHIFT + ENTER** or click the **Play** button for the paragraph to run the snippet.

trans-unit.source: The status on the right-corner of the paragraph should progress from READY, PENDING, RUNNING to FINISHED.
trans-unit.target: The status on the right-corner of the paragraph should progress from READY, PENDING, RUNNING to FINISHED.

trans-unit.source: The output shows up at the bottom of the same paragraph.
trans-unit.target: The output shows up at the bottom of the same paragraph.

trans-unit.source: The screenshot looks like the following:
trans-unit.target: The screenshot looks like the following:

trans-unit.source: ![Create a temporary table from raw data](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.note.loaddataintotable.png "Create a temporary table from raw data")
trans-unit.target: ![Create a temporary table from raw data](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.note.loaddataintotable.png "Create a temporary table from raw data")

trans-unit.source: You can also provide a title to each paragraph.
trans-unit.target: You can also provide a title to each paragraph.

trans-unit.source: From the right-hand corner, click the **Settings** icon, and then click **Show title**.
trans-unit.target: From the right-hand corner, click the **Settings** icon, and then click **Show title**.

trans-unit.source: You can now run Spark SQL statements on the **hvac** table.
trans-unit.target: You can now run Spark SQL statements on the **hvac** table.

trans-unit.source: Paste the following query in a new paragraph.
trans-unit.target: Paste the following query in a new paragraph.

trans-unit.source: The query retrieves the building ID and the difference between the target and actual temperatures for each building on a given date.
trans-unit.target: The query retrieves the building ID and the difference between the target and actual temperatures for each building on a given date.

trans-unit.source: Press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: The **%sql** statement at the beginning tells the notebook to use the Spark SQL interpreter.
trans-unit.target: The **%sql** statement at the beginning tells the notebook to use the Spark SQL interpreter.

trans-unit.source: You can look at the defined interpreters from the **Interpreter** tab in the notebook header.
trans-unit.target: You can look at the defined interpreters from the **Interpreter** tab in the notebook header.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows the output.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows the output.

trans-unit.source: ![Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.note.sparksqlquery1.png "Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook")
trans-unit.target: ![Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.note.sparksqlquery1.png "Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook")

trans-unit.source: Click the display options (highlighted in rectangle) to switch between different representations for the same output.
trans-unit.target: Click the display options (highlighted in rectangle) to switch between different representations for the same output.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.

trans-unit.source: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key and the average of **temp_diff** as the value.
trans-unit.target: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key and the average of **temp_diff** as the value.

trans-unit.source: You can also run Spark SQL statements using variables in the query.
trans-unit.target: You can also run Spark SQL statements using variables in the query.

trans-unit.source: The next snippet shows how to define a variable, **Temp**, in the query with the possible values you want to query with.
trans-unit.target: The next snippet shows how to define a variable, **Temp**, in the query with the possible values you want to query with.

trans-unit.source: When you first run the query, a drop-down is automatically populated with the values you specified for the variable.
trans-unit.target: When you first run the query, a drop-down is automatically populated with the values you specified for the variable.

trans-unit.source: Paste this snippet in a new paragraph and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.
trans-unit.target: Paste this snippet in a new paragraph and press **SHIFT + ENTER**.

trans-unit.source: The following screenshot shows the output.
trans-unit.target: The following screenshot shows the output.

trans-unit.source: ![Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.note.sparksqlquery2.png "Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook")
trans-unit.target: ![Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.note.sparksqlquery2.png "Run a Spark SQL statement using the notebook")

trans-unit.source: For subsequent queries, you can select a new value from the drop-down and run the query again.
trans-unit.target: For subsequent queries, you can select a new value from the drop-down and run the query again.

trans-unit.source: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.
trans-unit.target: Click **Settings** to choose what consitutes the key and values in the output.

trans-unit.source: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key, the average of **temp_diff** as the value, and **targettemp** as the group.
trans-unit.target: The screen capture above uses **buildingID** as the key, the average of **temp_diff** as the value, and **targettemp** as the group.

trans-unit.source: Restart the Spark SQL interpreter to exit the application.
trans-unit.target: Restart the Spark SQL interpreter to exit the application.

trans-unit.source: Click the **Interpreter** tab at the top, and for the Spark interpreter, click **Restart**.
trans-unit.target: Click the **Interpreter** tab at the top, and for the Spark interpreter, click **Restart**.

trans-unit.source: ![Restart the Zeppelin intepreter](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.zeppelin.restart.interpreter.png "Restart the Zeppelin intepreter")
trans-unit.target: ![Restart the Zeppelin intepreter](./media/hdinsight-apache-spark-zeppelin-notebook-jupyter-spark-sql-v1/hdispark.zeppelin.restart.interpreter.png "Restart the Zeppelin intepreter")
